item.description:
Soroptomist International of Greater New Haven and Fairfield University's Project Peg present a staged reading of

Body & Sold
a Documentary Play by Deborah Lake Fortson, playwright

"It's a play that I'm working on about human trafficking called "Body & Sold." Kind of a heavy topic, but a very important one. I'd like to make it an NHC event. All the details are below."
-- Sandra


Sunday November 23, 2008 2:00pm
at The Little Theater, 1 Lincoln St., New Haven
(Just north of the Audobon Arts District)
Tickets: $10 in advance or at the door- cash or check only at the door
For online ticket sales, go to www.ticketleap.com and search for "Body & Sold"
Proceeds to benefit Ahava Kids
Panel discussion to follow the performance
For information, tickets, or group discounts email nhsoroptimist@yahoo.com

The non-profit group Soroptimist International (SI) is an organization that works to improve the lives of women and girls locally, nationally and globally. (NHCers Courtney, Sandra, Meghan and Dana are members of SI.) Currently one of their key focus areas is working to stop human trafficking. The New Haven chapter of SI will be presenting a stage reading of the very powerful play "Body & Sold." This play tells the stories of 10 American kids who are victims of sex trafficking.

Although the characters are fictional, the play is closely based on interviews of actual victims in the U.S. This play really puts a face on trafficking victims and helps to remind us that this is not just a global crisis, it's a local crisis too. Hartford was one of the cities the playwright visited to conduct her interviews. We hope you'll come to help raise awareness about this very important issue. We guarantee you'll be moved.


NHC'er Sandra will be the contact for this event; she will put contact info in her RSVP.
item.name: "Body and Sold," a Documentary Play about Human Trafficking
